metadata.synopsis: The gith caretaker asks what the player is doing in the hatchery. They can learn some interesting lore about githyanki eggs. The player can also convince the caretaker to give them the last unhatched egg - but he is quite attached to it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Use Debug Book to travel to Act 1b -> Creche - Main Creche floorGet through the dialog with the guards at the checkpoint (you'll likely need to use killcombat in recon)Once through the doors go left (west), then right (north), and enter the Hatchery Chamber through the door at the end of the corridor.Head north and jump across the rocks in the acid.  Speak to the caretaker standing at the top of a large rocky outcrop.

3.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
3.text: I don't have time to parent you as well. What do you want now?

12.speaker: Player
12.text: You're being very protective of this egg - why?
12.context: InternalNodeContext: He doesn't want to let on how big a deal this is, but it's not a good sign. Not good at all.

92.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
92.text: It's taking a little longer than expected to hatch.
92.context: InternalNodeContext: He doesn't want to let on how big a deal this is, but it's not a good sign. Not good at all.

6.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
6.text: The conditions must not be disturbed if it is to have a fighting chance.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I want the egg. How much for it?

80.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
80.text: Is this some sort of grotesque attempt at humour?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Our broods are bigger than this, kin. Where are the others?

111.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
111.text: An accurate assessment. They hatched promptly and are well into their training.

0.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
0.text: This one is just proving slow.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: This egg would do better away from the tyranny of our kind. Give it to me and I'll give it a better life.

41.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
41.text: Careful, kin. You tread close to blasphemy. Do not overstep.

22.text: Careful, kin. You tread close to blasphemy. Do not overstep.

21.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
21.text: Careful, kin. You tread close to blasphemy. Do not overstep.

4.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
4.text: An egg. You murdered a defenceless egg!

11.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
11.text: You will pay for this. Htak'a!
11.context: NodeContext: quivering with rage [huh-tack-AH =  a battle cry meaning "attack!"]

26.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
26.context: NodeContext: You caught the player trying to get close to your precious egg.

28.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
28.text: This hatchery is a place of solemn duty and care. No one approaches an egg without my permission.
28.context: NodeContext: You caught the player trying to get close to your precious egg.

112.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
112.text: Of course, a stranger from a strange crèche may have different customs. What brings you here?
112.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I am here to help you save the egg.
37.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

117.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
117.text: This egg is in my care. It does not need saving.
117.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

1.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
1.text: It is a little slower to hatch, nothing more.
1.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Failure at the first hurdle of existence. Most caretakers would crush it and be done.
30.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

120.speaker: Lae'zel
120.text: Failure at the first hurdle of existence. Most caretakers would crush it and be done.
120.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Most caretakers would not give the child its fair chance, but I shall. There could be greatness in that shell.
24.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

99.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
99.text: Most caretakers would not give the child its fair chance, but I shall. There could be greatness in that shell.
99.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

75.speaker: Player
75.text: *You note that the hope in his voice is tinged with weariness. It's the voice of a man who's fought the inevitable for a long time.*
75.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

86.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
86.text: *You note that the hope in his voice is tinged with weariness. It's the voice of a man who's fought the inevitable for a long time.*
86.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *You note that the hope in his voice is tinged with weariness. It's the voice of a man who's fought the inevitable for a long time.*
46.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Tell me the truth. Why do you really care about this one so much?
36.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

61.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
61.text: Not all that arrive late are weak. I created this entire hatchery, despite being the last of my clutch to hatch.
61.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

59.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
59.text: Not all that arrive late are weak. I created this entire hatchery, despite being the last of my clutch to hatch.
59.context: NodeContext: Restrained sadness that he tries not to show; perhaps bitter mirth in the second sentence

20.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
20.text: They almost drowned me in the hatching pool. If it wasn't for the varsh of my clutch -
20.context: InternalNodeContext: He trails off, thinking of how lucky he was.

77.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
77.text: This one deserves the same chance.
77.context: InternalNodeContext: He catches himself mid-sentimental-moment and resumes his more professional air.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: What will happen to this egg if it doesn't hatch?
47.context: NodeContext: Hesistant; he doesn't want to destroy the egg

49.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
49.text: Kith'rak Therezzyn will give orders to destroy it. She will say it's a weakling.
49.context: NodeContext: Hesistant; he doesn't want to destroy the egg

73.speaker: Player
73.text: This seems like an awful lot of fuss for one egg.
73.context: InternalNodeContext: He desperately wants this egg to hatch, even though he knows it probably won't.

35.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
35.text: Kith'rak Therezzyn is of the same opinion. She would see it destroyed and forgotten.
35.context: InternalNodeContext: He desperately wants this egg to hatch, even though he knows it probably won't.

124.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
124.text: I'll give it a while longer, and if it doesn't hatch - it will have proven her right.
124.context: InternalNodeContext: He desperately wants this egg to hatch, even though he knows it probably won't.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Why bother? This egg's clearly a dud.

63.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
63.text: That is for me to decide.

18.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
18.text: Time for you to leave, I think, kin. And do not touch the egg.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Why risk its life at all? Give it to me - I'll take care of it.

48.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
48.text: You? You've no varsh instincts about you at all.

67.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
67.text: You? You've no varsh instincts about you at all.

90.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
90.text: Still, the captain's due for an inspection any day now, and if she sees it here...
90.context: InternalNodeContext: He's torn by this decision, an impossible decision. NodeContext: the captain will destroy his precious egg if she finds it

42.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
42.text: Tell me, what will you do with it if I entrust it to you?
42.context: InternalNodeContext: He's reluctant to part with it, having grown very fond of it. But knows it's for the best.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'll raise it as if it were my own flesh and blood.
15.context: InternalNodeContext: He's reluctant to part with it, having grown very fond of it. But knows it's for the best.

58.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
58.text: Hm. Just beware that adoptive piety does not turn to sentimentality.
58.context: InternalNodeContext: He's reluctant to part with it, having grown very fond of it. But knows it's for the best.

66.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
66.text: Though it could be the only way this one reaches adulthood, I fear.

101.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
101.context: InternalNodeContext: He's reluctant to part with it, having grown very fond of it. But knows it's for the best.

13.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
13.text: Still, I'm sure it's nature will pervade, even if raised among lesser species.
13.context: InternalNodeContext: He's reluctant to part with it, having grown very fond of it. But knows it's for the best.

104.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
104.text: I can no longer ignore that Kith'rak Therezzyn's patience has its limits.

81.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
81.text: Very well. Here - take these - they will aid you approach the egg.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I'll make the best omelette you've ever tasted.
122.context: NodeContext: Forceful response to "I'm gonna turn your egg into an omlette." Combat starts afterwards

9.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
9.context: NodeContext: Forceful response to "I'm gonna turn your egg into an omlette." Combat starts afterwards

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I'll see that it becomes the greatest ghaik-slayer you've ever seen.

127.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
127.text: Not an easy task. And far harder without a crèche to train it in.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'll find another crèche. One that's more forgiving.

64.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
64.text: Do you think the Sword Coast is littered with crèches? That you found this one was unlikely enough.

33.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
33.text: But you've a spirit about you that's quite inspiring. Perhaps even equal to the challenge.

25.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
25.text: Unlikely, but the journey may yet be character-forming.
25.context: NodeContext: Reluctant to hand over the egg; a threat through gritted teeth

82.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
82.text: I do this under protest. But it is what's best.
82.context: NodeContext: Reluctant to hand over the egg; a threat through gritted teeth

44.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
44.text: Just know that if the child comes to harm, I will find you, drag you back here, and drown you in the burning waters.
44.context: NodeContext: Reluctant to hand over the egg; a threat through gritted teeth

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Depends, how much do you think these things sell for?
50.context: NodeContext: Player just said they'd sell your egg. Combat follows.

107.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
107.context: NodeContext: Player just said they'd sell your egg. Combat follows.

79.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
79.text: You? What do you know about githyanki child-rearing?

5.text: No! The child will be safer with me. I know what it needs.

57.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
57.text: No! The child will be safer with me. I know what it needs.

16.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
16.text: This is my duty. I will protect it.
16.context: InternalNodeContext: He doesn't really believe himself - the captain will have his neck for this, but it's an unspoken sacrifice he's prepared to make. NodeContext: Stress "I"

8.speaker: Player
8.text: You're out of time and clearly stalling - that's why Kith'rak Therezzyn sent me to bring it to her. Hand it over.

109.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
109.text: I see. I cannot deny that I had hoped for more time.

14.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
14.text: I see. I cannot deny that I had hoped for more time.

96.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
96.text: But the kith'rak speaks for our Queen. And I live to serve. Fine. You can take it.

78.text: It would certainly be her style to send a messenger in her stead for a task like that.

103.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
103.text: It would certainly be her style to send a messenger in her stead for a task like that.

102.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
102.text: If she really wants it, she can come and get it herself.

97.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
97.text: But if I know her, she's too busy for that.

126.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
126.text: An istik? Don't make me laugh.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: You're wasting time. Give it to me now or I'll tell her you're the weakling.
123.context: NodeContext: Incredulous; you dare challenge one as experienced as him?

91.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
91.context: NodeContext: Incredulous; you dare challenge one as experienced as him?

116.text: You think I haven't defended our broods against worthier opponents than you? Idiot.
116.context: NodeContext: Incredulous; you dare challenge one as experienced as him?

10.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
10.text: You think I haven't defended our broods against worthier opponents than you? Idiot.
10.context: NodeContext: Incredulous; you dare challenge one as experienced as him?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Let me help - I can take it somewhere safe.

29.text: I do not midwife the birth of your young - do not tell me how to care for mine.
29.context: NodeContext: Irritated at the player's probing

85.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
85.text: I do not midwife the birth of your young - do not tell me how to care for mine.
85.context: NodeContext: Irritated at the player's probing

118.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
118.text: It is a dangerous world out there - I'm sure you know that.

93.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
93.text: We cannot afford to discard warriors because we are simply impatient.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Why do you care so much about one dud egg?

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I wanted to see the hatchery. I didn't expect it to look so empty.
62.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'dare'. Combat starts after this line.

68.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
68.text: Almost all of the eggs in this clutch have hatched. We await only one more, which is... taking its time.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: I am curious about the egg you guard.
45.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'dare'. Combat starts after this line.

83.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
83.text: There is little to be curious about. It is taking its time hatching, nothing more.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I came here to steal an egg.
115.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'dare'. Combat starts after this line.

27.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
27.text: How dare you? Your bones will melt in the hatching pool, you insolent whelp!
27.context: NodeContext: Stress on 'dare'. Combat starts after this line.

54.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
54.text: Still, I suppose a guest in our crèche can be allowed some understanding. What brings you to my hatchery?

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I heard you're waiting for one last egg to hatch.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: You mistook me for someone. Who were you expecting?

110.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
110.text: Someone with orders from our commander to destroy this egg.

70.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
70.text: You can tell Kith'rak Therezzyn that my position has not changed: the egg requires more time. Furthermore - oh.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Starts the dialog facing directly away from the player. Turns on 'Furthermore'NodeContext: You turn on 'Furthermore' expecting to see an angry guard, but you're surprised to find the player - a complete stranger.

74.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
74.text: You are not from Crèche Y'llek. What are you doing here?

119.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
119.text: I was not expecting an istik. What brings you to my hatchery?

88.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
88.text: Well? Will you take the egg or not?

98.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
98.text: Did you think me a fool? Did you think I wouldn't notice the theft of our final egg?

113.speaker: Varsh Ko'kuu
113.text: You've got the egg haven't you? Be on your way then. Before I change my mind.
113.context: InternalNodeContext: He gave us permission to take it, but is sad to see it go nonetheless, and masking this with terseness.
